ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Bodh started around two hundrer schools by means of community participation and later handed it over to the government to sustain. Similarly the pedagogy and teacher education programme of Bodh has been scaled across all schools of Rajasthan by means of a quality reform programme of the Government. Bodh has also technically supported around hundred like minded organizations . So far Bodh has supported around nine million children to finish elementary education.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: To support quality education by developing worksheets, classroom Modules, teaching methodologies and providing training to teachers in govt. primary schools in Rajasthan. To support experimental schools of Bodh Shiksha Samiti for testing pedagogy.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: CDECS is a Value based development organization conceived and initiated by academicians, grass roots experts, ex-government think tank & development professionals. They have been mentoring organizations & contributing to the field of development through their knowledge, skill, and expertise at State & National level for over one and a half decade. Institutionally, we believe in providing solutions and services to the socio-economic sectors which will enable them to grow and develop in a sustainable manner. We feel that our forte lies in empowering our partners, stakeholders and beneficiaries in creating and implementing solutions that will not only give them long-term benefits but also help in maximizing quality and effective functioning. Thus, we continuously strive to ensure quality, timeliness and change through our range of services & expertise. We put the â€˜peopleâ€™ into the focus while drawing & designing solutions and strategies. Upon this, and bearing in mind the kind of expertise & kind of services we offer, our purpose is to set in the doable strategies which would be helpful and compatible for the people, area and governance. This would be of great help and sensitiveness for the social cause of the deprived and the underprivileged. We always try to provide enough to develop capacities of our partners, stakeholders and beneficiaries associated to our principals everywhere and every time they need. As an organization we invest in ourselves so that we can offer cutting-edge products to beneficiaries, stakeholders and partners with which we work for. This is important to us as we want to foster long term relationship and look for better processes and outcome which definitely have longer sustainability and utility for larger number of people and would also help in developing stronger bond & relationship. CDECS a name for catalyzing the development intervention in the development sector specially the socio-economic development sector to facilitate real development. Organizationally, we focus on Training, Research, & Development Intervention in socio-economic and Infrastructure development to support better Management in the endeavor. Our ideology revolves around building sustainable models within the social sector, Water sector, Agriculture, Infrastructure & economic development sector and those delivery critical services efficiently and equitably to underserved communities. It is our belief that in a globalize world for any development activity to be effective the involvement and contribution of all stakeholders direct or indirect plays an important role in making it responsive, responsible and sustainable for the communities in question. In this effort we work together with Governments, Communities, Corporate and Civil society institutions to channelise their collective resources â€“ financial, technical and human â€“ into creating new approaches to solve widespread poverty-related issues across the country to make the most efficient and equitable use of every rupee spent in the sector. There has been proven in our journey since 1996 from Trainings, Research & Development interventions to have greater partnerships which would helped to create sustainable, affordable solutions to pretty lingered development problems of the society in the State: ensuring the Human rights, Rights of a Child, Gender Development, Environment protection, Land & Water conservation, Agriculture development, RTE Act, Health & RCH, HIV/AIDS, Women development, Sustainable Livelihoods opportunities for the underserved and Safe Drinking Water and Sanitation to rural households. CDECS has experience of working in 33 districts of Rajasthan in trainings, research & development interventions. In addition, we have experience of working in other states too in the areas of Trainings, Researches namely, Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan, Goa, Jharkhand, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Orissa, Chhattisgarh, and Maharashtra through touching the lives of over 1.2 lac people. CDECS has wide experience of Monitoring & Evaluation (Baseline, Mid-term & end line) in Land development, afforestation, Integrated Watershed Management Programme, CDP, DDP and Haryali in which the major emphasis was given on land development, afforestation, rain water conservation through various structures in varied zone of Rajasthan i.e. Tanks, Anicut, DLT, contour bunding, Gabion structures, Biodiversity conservations, sand dunes stabilizations, silvipastoral plantation, fuel wood plantation, fruit tree plantation, pastureland development etc. were the key interventions. Organizationally we have been associated with evaluation of Forest department projects of social forestry, afforestation, sand dunes stabilization under DDP, CDP and Haryali projects in various parts of Rajasthan. We have experience of undertaking evaluation studies, monitoring, research studies, and Impact studies in various sectors namely, Socio-economic, Environment, Community Building & Social Inclusion, Infrastructure development and capacity building trainings. In total we have undertaken more than 30 studies with support from Government of India, UNICEF, UNFPA, Government of Rajasthan on rural development, socio-economic development etc. We have working with State Government, Government of India, UNICEF, WaterAID India and UNFPA in various districts of the country including Rajasthan too. Our efforts have of monitoring and evaluations have been appreciated by various agencies at various fronts. Recently, we have been ranked second out of 21 agencies with 81 marks out of 100 in the panel of YASHDHA, Pune for evaluation of trainings and capacity building programme undertaken by the department. It was Jagrati Experience in rural areas that people living specially in very backward areas are suffering from different diseases due to their ignorance on self cleanliness. Another important factor is that the rural women and girls generally do not maintain cleanliness during menstruation period.

Today, self help group has become the vehicle of change for the poor and marginalized. Self-help group is a method of organizing the poor people and the marginalized to come together to solve their individual problem. The SHG method is used by the government, NGOs and others worldwide. The poor collect their savings and save it in banks. In return they receive easy access to loans with a small rate of interest to start their micro unit enterprise.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Jagriti envisions to eradicate illiteracy amongst underprivileged children across slums to uplift and empower them by imparting quality education and vocational training to their families, he wish to see smile on the faces of all such children for a happy, satisfied and dignified life. Areas of Focus 1. Providing total free of cost value based quality Education to underprivileged children with a special focus on children living in slums, till they are financially self sufficient and live a respectable life 2. Vocational training programs with a view to empower their mothers and sisters from the slums to make them self dependent 3. Free of cost Mobile Mortuary Services 24 x 7, where the body of deceased can be kept for few days till the near and dear one arrives. With 13 such mortuary machines the service is being provided free of cost and more than 5000 people are benefitted with this. 4. This has resulted in a big increase in eye donation. Jagriti is responsible for more than 1000 cornea donations till now, with this support there is no waiting list for corneas now. 5. Blood donation drives 6. Many Cancer detection and treatment camps in slums with special focus on cancer cervix. 7. Tree plantation â€“ in last few years lot of trees have been planted 8. Basti cleaning drive Education to underprivileged Children Education is the foundation of any individual and the Nation. Jagriti started with 1 School and 30 Children in 2011 and today it has 11 Schools and 2512 Children from slums. Who are imparted with value based and quality education. Most of the schools have a growth of more than 200-300 percentage. How do we go 1. We go to the slum areas 2. Do extensive and exhaustive door to door survey, Enroll the parents and motivate children to come to school 3. Adopt the Government or Public schools keeping in mind the footfall and distance from the nearby kachibasti. 4. After adoption we reconstruct the building aesthetically keeping in view the needs. 5. Separate Toilet blocks for Girls, Boys and Teachers are provided 6. Water station with RO system is provided. 7. Provide 2 sets of Trousers and Knickers, Shirts; Ribbons, Belt, Shoes, Socks, Sweater, Salwar and legging (for girls), School Bag. Stationary, Books and Mid-day-meal to children (of private schools) absolutely free of cost. 8. Teachers are provided besides already existing Government teachers. 9. Medical camps are organized twice a year. 10. Sanskar camps are held to imbibe cultural values, ethics, manners, etiquettes right from the tender age. 11. Various Art & Craft activities take place to nurture innovation and creativity in our children. 12. We introduced a concept Bal Chaupaal held on weekends it has fun filled education and recreational activities. 13. Regular parent teacher meeting are held in all schools 14. We ensure that our children are exposed to outer world. 15. We organize student enrollment rallies through the lanes of slums to inspire and enroll the non-school going children.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Jai Bhairv Welfare Society is a non-profit community based organization working towards peopole empowerment, education and livelihood promotion. JBWS aspires to improve the living conditions of the poor and marginalized by adopting strategies & Technology through community initiative, participation and sensitization. Founded in 2009, the organization has worked among the villagers and boarder area of Rajasthan. People self-help groups have been taken as the base for all interventions and livelihood activities enabling them to contribute towards mainstream development process. The main objectives of the Project are: To strengthen the income-generating capacity of the unemployed youth, with a special focus on rural unemployed youth. To facilitate the groups to develop their managerial and technical capabilities so that they manage their micro enterprise efficiently. To establish effective linkages between the Rural Youth and all major support organizations by creating a single platform for communication. To provide market information and develop the capacity of the Rural Artisans for conducting market research. To promote community based organizations at grassroots level for sustainable development in rural and coastal areas. Currently, both companies share the same management, operating address and human resources.

JAIN PHILOSOPHY IS CONSIDERED TO BE RATIONAL, LOGICAL AND SCIENTIFIC IN ITS APPROACH BUT A COMPARATIVE STUDY OF VARIOUS PRINCIPLES WITH MODERN SCIENTIFIC THOUGHT HAVE NOT YET BEEN MADE.
